- At turn T, we are on y (so we check the car on freeway y at turn T).

The minimal number of turns \(H\) to reach \((0, 9)\) from the initial position \((0, 0)\) at turn \(t_1 = 0\), while avoiding collisions with cars on freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\), is 18. This requires 18 actions from turn 0 to turn 17, resulting in the player reaching \(y = 9\) at turn 18.

The sequence of actions is designed to:
- Move up to \(y = 1\) at turn 1.
- Stay at \(y = 1\) (freeway 1, which is always safe) from turns 1 to 9 to avoid collisions on freeways 2-8 during turns 8 and 9, when those freeways are unsafe.
- After turn 9, move up consecutively from \(y = 1\) to \(y = 9\) over the next 8 turns, ensuring that:
  - Freeways 2-6 are only visited at turns \(\geq 10\) (safe, as they are unsafe only at turns 8 and 9).
  - Freeway 7 is visited at turn 15 (safe, as unsafe at turns 2, 3, 8, 9).
  - Freeway 8 is visited at turn 16 (safe, as unsafe at turns 2, 3, 8, 9) and turn 17 (safe for the same reason).

The action sequence is:

\boxed{
\text{Turn } 0: \text{ U} \\
\text{Turn } 1: \text{ S} \\
\text{Turn } 2: \text{ S} \\
\text{Turn } 3: \text{ S} \\
\text{Turn } 4: \text{ S} \\
\text{Turn } 5: \text{ S} \\
\text{Turn } 6: \text{ S} \\
\text{Turn } 7: \text{ S} \\
\text{Turn } 8: \text{ S} \\
\text{Turn } 9: \text{ S} \\
\text{Turn } 10: \text{ U} \\
\text{Turn } 11: \text{ U} \\
\text{Turn } 12: \text{ U} \\
\text{Turn } 13: \text{ U} \\
\text{Turn } 14: \text{ U} \\
\text{Turn } 15: \text{ U} \\
\text{Turn } 16: \text{ U} \\
\text{Turn } 17: \text{ U}
}

The minimal number of turns \(H\) to reach \((0, 9)\) from the initial position \((0, 2)\) at turn \(t_1 = 3\) is 14. The sequence of actions avoids collisions with cars on the freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\) by ensuring the player is not on any dangerous freeway at critical times. Specifically:

- The player stays at \(y = 2\) for turns 3 to 5 to avoid the danger on \(y = 1\) at turn 6.
- At turn 6, the player moves down to \(y = 1\) to prepare for the critical turns 8 and 9.
- The player stays at \(y = 1\) for turns 7 and 8 (positions at times 8 and 9) because \(y = 1\) is safe at these times, while freeways \(y = 2\) to \(y = 8\) are dangerous due to cars covering \(x = 0\).
- From turn 9 onwards, the player moves up directly to \(y = 9\), as all freeways are safe after turn 9.

The action sequence is as follows:

- **Turn 3 (action S)**: Stay at \(y = 2\) (position at time 4: \((0, 2)\); safe, as freeway 2 car span at time 4 is \([-35, -24]\), no 0).
- **Turn 4 (action S)**: Stay at \(y = 2\) (position at time 5: \((0, 2)\); safe, span at time 5 is \([-29, -18]\), no 0).
- **Turn 5 (action S)**: Stay at \(y = 2\) (position at time 6: \((0, 2)\); safe, span at time 6 is \([-23, -12]\), no 0).
- **Turn 6 (action D)**: Move down to \(y = 1\) (position at time 7: \((0, 1)\); safe, span for freeway 1 at time 7 is \([1, 12]\), no 0).
- **Turn 7 (action S)**: Stay at \(y = 1\) (position at time 8: \((0, 1)\); safe, span at time 8 is \([13, 24]\), no 0).
- **Turn 8 (action S)**: Stay at \(y = 1\) (position at time 9: \((0, 1)\); safe, span at time 9 is \([25, 36]\), no 0).
- **Turn 9 (action U)**: Move up to \(y = 2\) (position at time 10: \((0, 2)\); safe, span for freeway 2 at time 10 is \([1, 12]\), no 0).
- **Turn 10 (action U)**: Move up to \(y = 3\) (position at time 11: \((0, 3)\); safe, span at time 11 is \([7, 18]\), no 0).
- **Turn 11 (action U)**: Move up to \(y = 4\) (position at time 12: \((0, 4)\); safe, span at time 12 is \([13, 24]\), no 0).

- **Turn 13 (action U)**: Move up to \(y = 6\) (position at time 14: \((0, 6)\); safe, span at time 14 is \([25, 36]\), no 0).
- **Turn 14 (action U)**: Move up to \(y = 7\) (position at time 15: \((0, 7)\); safe, as cars on freeway 7 at time 15: first car span \([19, 30]\), second car \([55, 66]\), third car \([67, 78]\), all no 0).
- **Turn 15 (action U)**: Move up to \(y = 8\) (position at time 16: \((0, 8)\); safe, cars on freeway 8 at time 16 similar to freeway 7, no 0).
- **Turn 16 (action U)**: Move up to \(y = 9\) (position at time 17: \((0, 9)\); goal reached, no freeway at y=9).

The dangerous turns are \(T = 8\) and \(T = 9\), where all freeways from \(y = 2\) to \(y = 8\) have cars covering the x-position 0, leading to a collision if the player is on any of these freeways. To avoid collisions, the player must be on \(y = 0\) or \(y = 1\) at turns 8 and 9, as these positions are safe:
- \(y = 0\) has no freeway and is always safe.
- \(y = 1\) (freeway 1) is safe at \(T = 8\) and \(T = 9\) because no car covers x=0 at these times (span at \(T=8\) is [13, 24], at \(T=9\) is [25, 36]).

The sequence starts at \(y = 2\) (turn 6). To reach \(y = 1\) by turn 8 and stay there until turn 9:

- From turn 10 to turn 16, actions \(U\) (up) each turn increase \(y\) from 2 to 9, reaching \(y = 9\) at turn 17.

The sequence of actions must ensure that the player is not on a freeway row \(y\) (for \(y = 1\) to \(8\)) at a time when any car on that row covers the position \(x = 0\).

### Analysis of Car Occupancy at \(x = 0\)
The occupancy of \(x = 0\) for each freeway row at time \(T\) (where \(\tau = T - t_1 = T - 8\)) is derived from the car states:
- **Freeway 1**: Always safe (no car covers \(x = 0\)).
- **Freeways 2-6**: Occupied at \(T = 8\) and \(T = 9\) (\(\tau = 0, 1\)); safe for \(T \geq 10\) (\(\tau \geq 2\)).
- **Freeways 7 and 8**: Occupied at \(T = 8, 9, 15, 16\) (\(\tau = 0, 1, 7, 8\)); safe at other times, including \(T = 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 17, \ldots\).

### Path Constraints
- The player starts at \(y = 0\) (safe) at \(T = 8\).
- To minimize turns, the player should move up (\(U\)) whenever possible, but must avoid being on an occupied row at the wrong time.
- Rows \(y = 2\) to \(y = 6\) can be safely occupied starting from \(T = 10\), with earliest arrival times: \(y = 1\) at \(T = 9\), \(y = 2\) at \(T = 10\), \(y = 3\) at \(T = 11\), \(y = 4\) at \(T = 12\), \(y = 5\) at \(T = 13\), \(y = 6\) at \(T = 14\).
- For row \(y = 7\), the earliest possible arrival time is \(T = 15\), but it is occupied at \(T = 15\) and \(T = 16\). The next safe time is \(T = 17\). Similarly, row \(y = 8\) must be occupied at \(T \geq 17\) (earliest safe arrival at \(T = 18\)).
- Thus, the player must wait at \(y = 6\) for two turns (at \(T = 15\) and \(T = 16\)) to avoid moving to \(y = 7\) during unsafe times. This results in arrival at \(y = 7\) at \(T = 17\), \(y = 8\) at \(T = 18\), and \(y = 9\) at \(T = 19\).

### Minimal Sequence of Actions
The sequence of actions from turn \(t_1 = 8\) to turn \(t_1 + 10 = 18\) (11 actions) achieves the goal at turn \(t_1 + 11 = 19\):
- Turns \(t_1\) to \(t_1 + 5\): Move up to reach \(y = 6\) by \(T = 14\).
- Turns \(t_1 + 6\) and \(t_1 + 7\): Stay at \(y = 6\) to wait for \(y = 7\) to become safe.
- Turns \(t_1 + 8\) to \(t_1 + 10\): Move up to reach \(y = 9\) by \(T = 19\).

This sequence is minimal because:
- Rows \(y = 7\) and \(y = 8\) cannot be occupied before \(T = 17\) and \(T = 18\), respectively, due to car occupancy constraints.
- Any attempt to reach \(y = 9\) earlier would require being on \(y = 7\) or \(y = 8\) during an unsafe time, causing collision.

The minimal number of turns \(H\) to reach \((0, 9)\) from the initial position \((0, 1)\) at turn \(t_1 = 10\) is 10, considering the need to avoid collisions with cars on freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\) during turns \(t = 15\) and \(t = 16\) for freeways \(y = 7\) and \(y = 8\).

### Collision Analysis:
- Freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 6\) are always safe for \(x = 0\) at all turns, as the car spans never cover \(x = 0\).
- Freeway \(y = 7\) is unsafe at turns \(t = 15\) and \(t = 16\) due to the car with initial span \([-41, -30]\) at \(t = 10\) (moving right at speed 6), which covers \(x = 0\) at these turns. It is safe at other turns (e.g., \(t = 14\) and \(t = 17\)).
- Freeway \(y = 8\) is similarly unsafe at turns \(t = 15\) and \(t = 16\) due to the same car configuration and safe at other turns.
- Freeway \(y = 9\) has no cars and is always safe.
- The player cannot be on \(y = 7\) or \(y = 8\) at \(t = 15\) or \(t = 16\) to avoid collision.

### Sequence Justification:
- The sequence starts with up actions (U) to increase \(y\) from 1 to 6 by turn \(t = 15\):
  - \(t = 10\): \(y = 1\) → action U → \(y_{11} = 2\)
  - \(t = 11\): \(y = 2\) → action U → \(y_{12} = 3\)
  - \(t = 12\): \(y = 3\) → action U → \(y_{13} = 4\)
  - \(t = 13\): \(y = 4\) → action U → \(y_{14} = 5\)
  - \(t = 14\): \(y = 5\) → action U → \(y_{15} = 6\)
- At \(t = 15\), \(y = 6\) (safe), and action S (stay) is taken to avoid moving to \(y = 7\) at \(t = 16\), resulting in \(y_{16} = 6\).
- At \(t = 16\), \(y = 6\) (safe), and action U is taken to move to \(y = 7\) at \(t = 17\).
- At \(t = 17\), \(y = 7\) is safe (since \(t = 17 > 16\)), and action U is taken to reach \(y = 8\) at \(t = 18\).
- At \(t = 18\), \(y = 8\) is safe (cars do not cover \(x = 0\) at \(t = 18\)), and action U is taken to reach \(y = 9\) at \(t = 19\).
- At \(t = 19\), \(y = 9\) (target reached). Action S is taken at \(t = 19\) as a placeholder since the position is already at \(y = 9\), and it does not affect the outcome.

### Collision Checks:
- \(t = 10\): \(y = 1\), safe (car span \([37, 48]\) does not cover \(0\)).
- \(t = 11\): \(y = 2\), safe (car span \([7, 18]\) does not cover \(0\)).
- \(t = 12\): \(y = 3\), safe (car span \([13, 24]\) does not cover \(0\)).
- \(t = 13\): \(y = 4\), safe (car span \([19, 30]\) does not cover \(0\)).
- \(t = 14\): \(y = 5\), safe (car span \([25, 36]\) does not cover \(0\)).
- \(t = 15\): \(y = 6\), safe (car span \([31, 42]\) does not cover \(0\)).
- \(t = 16\): \(y = 6\), safe (same as above).
- \(t = 17\): \(y = 7\), safe (car span \([1, 12]\) does not cover \(0\) at \(t = 17\)).
- \(t = 18\): \(y = 8\), safe (car span \([7, 18]\) does not cover \(0\) at \(t = 18\)).
- \(t = 19\): \(y = 9\), safe (no cars).

This sequence achieves \(y_{19} = 9\) at turn \(t = 19\) (since \(t_1 + H - 1 = 10 + 10 - 1 = 19\)) with \(H = 10\) turns, avoiding all collisions.

\boxed{
Turn 10: U \\
Turn 11: U \\
Turn 12: U \\
Turn 13: U \\
Turn 14: U \\
Turn 15: S \\
Turn 16: U \\
Turn 17: U \\
Turn 18: U \\
Turn 19: S
}

The player starts at position (0, 6) at turn \(t_1 = 16\) and needs to reach (0, 9) in the minimal number of turns \(H\) while avoiding collisions with cars on freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\).

### Analysis:
- The minimum number of turns required to move from \(y = 6\) to \(y = 9\) is 3, as each "U" action increases \(y\) by 1, and no fewer actions can achieve this.
- Collision occurs only if the player is on a freeway row \(y_t\) (where \(1 \leq y_t \leq 8\)) at turn \(t\), and a car on that row has a span that includes x=0 at the absolute time \(T = 16 + t\) (where \(t\) is the turn index relative to \(t_1 = 16\)).

#### Car Span and Dangerous Times:

The player starts at position (0, 7) at turn \(t_1 = 17\). The goal is to reach (0, 9) at turn \(t_1 + H - 1 = 17 + H - 1\) with the minimal number of actions \(H\), avoiding collisions with cars on freeways \(y = 1\) to \(y = 8\).

### Analysis:
- From the initial position \(y = 7\), reaching \(y = 9\) requires an increase of 2 units in the vertical position. Since each action (U, D, or S) changes \(y\) by at most 1, at least 2 actions are needed to reach \(y = 9\). However:
  - After 1 action (at turn 17), \(y_{18}\) can be 6, 7, or 8 (not 9).
  - After 2 actions (at turns 17 and 18), \(y_{19}\) can be 5 to 9, so \(y_{19} = 9\) is possible.
- The turn to reach \(y = 9\) is \(t_1 + H - 1\). For \(H = 2\), this turn is \(17 + 2 - 1 = 18\), but \(y_{18} \leq 8\), so reaching \(y = 9\) at turn 18 is impossible. For \(H = 3\), the turn is \(17 + 3 - 1 = 19\), and \(y_{19} = 9\) can be achieved.
- Thus, the minimal \(H\) is 3, with the goal position reached at turn 19.

### Collision Avoidance:
- **At turn 17 (player on \(y = 7\)):**  
  Cars on freeway 7 at \(T = 17\) (relative to \(t_1 = 17\), \(\Delta t = 0\)):
  - Car 1: \((54, 43, \text{right}, 6)\), span = \([43, 54]\) → \(0 \notin [43, 54]\)
  - Car 2: \((-24, -35, \text{right}, 6)\), span = \([-35, -24]\) → \(0 \notin [-35, -24]\)
  - Car 3: \((12, 1, \text{right}, 6)\), span = \([1, 12]\) → \(0 \notin [1, 12]\)  
  No collision at turn 17.

- **Action at turn 17: U** → \(y_{18} = 7 + 1 = 8\)

- **At turn 18 (player on \(y = 8\)):**  
  Cars on freeway 8 at \(T = 18\) (\(\Delta t = 1\)):
  - Car 1: \((54, 43, \text{right}, 6)\), span = \([43 + 6 \times 1, 54 + 6 \times 1] = [49, 60]\) → \(0 \notin [49, 60]\)
  - Car 2: \((-24, -35, \text{right}, 6)\), span = \([-35 + 6 \times 1, -24 + 6 \times 1] = [-29, -18]\) → \(0 \notin [-29, -18]\)
  - Car 3: \((12, 1, \text{right}, 6)\), span = \([1 + 6 \times 1, 12 + 6 \times 1] = [7, 18]\) → \(0 \notin [7, 18]\) (since \(0 < 7\))  
  No collision at turn 18.

- **Action at turn 18: U** → \(y_{19} = 8 + 1 = 9\)

- **At turn 19 (player on \(y = 9\)):**  
  \(y = 9\) has no freeway, so no collision possible. The position (0, 9) is reached.

- **Action at turn 19: S** → \(y_{20} = 9\) (to stay at the goal; this action is required for \(H = 3\) but does not affect the position at turn 19).

### Conclusion:
The minimal number of turns \(H\) is 3, with the sequence:
- Turn 17: U (move up to \(y = 8\) at turn 18)
- Turn 18: U (move up to \(y = 9\) at turn 19)
- Turn 19: S (stay at \(y = 9\) for completeness)

This sequence avoids all collisions and reaches (0, 9) at turn 19 (\(t_1 + H - 1 = 17 + 3 - 1 = 19\)).

\boxed{ \text{Turn } 17: \text{ U} \\ \text{Turn } 18: \text{ U} \\ \text{Turn } 19: \text{ S} }
